org.apache.commons.rdf.simple

Class AbstractRDFParserBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.commons.rdf.simple.AbstractRDFParserBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, RDFParserBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractRDFParserBuilder
extends Object
implements RDFParserBuilder, Cloneable
    Abstract RDFParserBuilder

    This abstract class keeps the builder properties in protected fields like sourceFile using Optional. Some basic checking like checkIsAbsolute(IRI) is performed.

    This class and its subclasses are Cloneable, immutable and (therefore) thread-safe - each call to option methods like contentType(String) or source(IRI) will return a cloned, mutated copy.

    By default, parsing is done by the abstract method parseSynchronusly() - which is executed in a cloned snapshot - hence multiple parse() calls are thread-safe. The default parse() uses a thread pool in threadGroup - but implementations can override parse() (e.g. because it has its own threading model or use asynchronou remote execution).

      • getRdfTermFactory

        public Optional<RDFTermFactory> getRdfTermFactory()

      • getContentTypeSyntax

        public Optional<RDFSyntax> getContentTypeSyntax()
        Get the set content-type RDFSyntax, if any.

        If this is Optional.isPresent(), then getContentType() contains the value of RDFSyntax.mediaType.

      • getContentType

        public final Optional<String> getContentType()
        Get the set content-type String, if any.

        If this is Optional.isPresent() and is recognized by RDFSyntax.byMediaType(String), then the corresponding RDFSyntax is set on getContentType(), otherwise that is Optional.empty().

      • getIntoGraph

        public Optional<Graph> getIntoGraph()
        Get the set Graph to insert into, if any.

        From the call to parseSynchronusly(), this method is always Optional.isPresent() with a new Graph instance, and will be the value returned from parse().

      • getBase

        public Optional<IRI> getBase()
        Get the set base IRI, if present.

      • getSourceInputStream

        public Optional<InputStream> getSourceInputStream()
        Get the set source InputStream.

        If this is Optional.isPresent(), then getSourceFile() and getSourceIri() are Optional.empty().

      • getSourceFile

        public Optional<Path> getSourceFile()
        Get the set source Path.

        If this is Optional.isPresent(), then getSourceInputStream() and getSourceIri() are Optional.empty().

      • getSourceIri

        public Optional<IRI> getSourceIri()
        Get the set source Path.

        If this is Optional.isPresent(), then getSourceInputStream() and getSourceInputStream()() are Optional.empty().

      • rdfTermFactory

        public RDFParserBuilder rdfTermFactory(RDFTermFactory rdfTermFactory)
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify which RDFTermFactory to use for generating RDFTerms.

        This option may be used together with RDFParserBuilder.intoGraph(Graph) to override the implementation's default factory and graph.

        Warning: Using the same RDFTermFactory for multiple RDFParserBuilder.parse() calls may accidentally merge BlankNodes having the same label, as the parser may use the RDFTermFactory.createBlankNode(String) method from the parsed blank node labels.

        Specified by:
        rdfTermFactory in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        rdfTermFactory - RDFTermFactory to use for generating RDFTerms.
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified rdfTermFactory
        See Also:
        RDFParserBuilder.intoGraph(Graph)

      • contentType

        public RDFParserBuilder contentType(RDFSyntax rdfSyntax)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify the content type of the RDF syntax to parse.

        This option can be used to select the RDFSyntax of the source, overriding any Content-Type headers or equivalent.

        The character set of the RDFSyntax is assumed to be StandardCharsets.UTF_8 unless overridden within the document (e.g. in RDFSyntax.RDFXML).

        This method will override any contentType set with RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String).

        Specified by:
        contentType in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        rdfSyntax - An RDFSyntax to parse the source according to, e.g. RDFSyntax.TURTLE.
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified content type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If this RDFParserBuilder does not support the specified RDFSyntax.
        See Also:
        RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String)

      • contentType

        public RDFParserBuilder contentType(String contentType)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify the content type of the RDF syntax to parse.

        This option can be used to select the RDFSyntax of the source, overriding any Content-Type headers or equivalent.

        The content type MAY include a charset parameter if the RDF media types permit it; the default charset is StandardCharsets.UTF_8 unless overridden within the document.

        This method will override any contentType set with RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax).

        Specified by:
        contentType in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        contentType - A content-type string, e.g. application/ld+json or text/turtle;charset="UTF-8" as specified by RFC7231.
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified content type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the contentType has an invalid syntax, or this RDFParserBuilder does not support the specified contentType.
        See Also:
        RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax)

      • intoGraph

        public RDFParserBuilder intoGraph(Graph graph)
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify which Graph to add triples to.

        The default (if this option has not been set) is that each call to RDFParserBuilder.parse() return a new Graph, which is created using RDFTermFactory.createGraph() if RDFParserBuilder.rdfTermFactory(RDFTermFactory) has been set.

        It is undefined if any triples are added to the specified Graph if the Future.get() returned from RDFParserBuilder.parse() throws any exceptions. (However implementations are free to prevent this using transaction mechanisms or similar). However, if Future.get() does not indicatean exception, the parser implementation SHOULD have inserted all parsed triples to the specified graph.

        Specified by:
        intoGraph in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        graph - The Graph to add triples into.
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will insert triples into the specified graph.

      • base

        public RDFParserBuilder base(IRI base)
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify a base IRI to use for parsing any relative IRI references.

        Setting this option will override any protocol-specific base IRI (e.g. Content-Location header) or the RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI) IRI, but does not override any base IRIs set within the source document (e.g. @base in Turtle documents).

        If the source is in a syntax that does not support relative IRI references (e.g. RDFSyntax.NTRIPLES), setting the base has no effect.

        This method will override any base IRI set with RDFParserBuilder.base(String).

        Specified by:
        base in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        base - An absolute IRI to use as a base.
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified base IRI.
        See Also:
        RDFParserBuilder.base(String)

      • base

        public RDFParserBuilder base(String base)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify a base IRI to use for parsing any relative IRI references.

        Setting this option will override any protocol-specific base IRI (e.g. Content-Location header) or the RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI) IRI, but does not override any base IRIs set within the source document (e.g. @base in Turtle documents).

        If the source is in a syntax that does not support relative IRI references (e.g. RDFSyntax.NTRIPLES), setting the base has no effect.

        This method will override any base IRI set with RDFParserBuilder.base(IRI).

        Specified by:
        base in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        base - An absolute IRI to use as a base.
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified base IRI.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the base is not a valid absolute IRI string
        See Also:
        RDFParserBuilder.base(IRI)

      • source

        public RDFParserBuilder source(InputStream inputStream)
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify a source InputStream to parse.

        The source set will not be read before the call to RDFParserBuilder.parse().

        The InputStream will not be closed after parsing. The InputStream does not need to support InputStream.markSupported().

        The parser might not consume the complete stream (e.g. an RDF/XML parser may not read beyond the closing tag of </rdf:Description>).

        The RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax) or RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String) SHOULD be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse().

        The character set is assumed to be StandardCharsets.UTF_8 unless the RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String) specifies otherwise or the document declares its own charset (e.g. RDF/XML with a <?xml encoding="iso-8859-1"> header).

        The RDFParserBuilder.base(IRI) or RDFParserBuilder.base(String) MUST be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse(), unless the RDF syntax does not permit relative IRIs (e.g. RDFSyntax.NTRIPLES).

        This method will override any source set with RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI), RDFParserBuilder.source(Path) or RDFParserBuilder.source(String).

        Specified by:
        source in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        inputStream - An InputStream to consume
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified source.

      • source

        public RDFParserBuilder source(Path file)
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify a source file Path to parse.

        The source set will not be read before the call to RDFParserBuilder.parse().

        The RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax) or RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String) SHOULD be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse().

        The character set is assumed to be StandardCharsets.UTF_8 unless the RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String) specifies otherwise or the document declares its own charset (e.g. RDF/XML with a <?xml encoding="iso-8859-1"> header).

        The RDFParserBuilder.base(IRI) or RDFParserBuilder.base(String) MAY be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse(), otherwise Path.toUri() will be used as the base IRI.

        This method will override any source set with RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI), RDFParserBuilder.source(InputStream) or RDFParserBuilder.source(String).

        Specified by:
        source in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        file - A Path for a file to parse
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified source.

      • source

        public RDFParserBuilder source(IRI iri)
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify an absolute source IRI to retrieve and parse.

        The source set will not be read before the call to RDFParserBuilder.parse().

        If this builder does not support the given IRI (e.g. urn:uuid:ce667463-c5ab-4c23-9b64-701d055c4890), this method should succeed, while the RDFParserBuilder.parse() should throw an IOException.

        The RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax) or RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String) MAY be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse(), in which case that type MAY be used for content negotiation (e.g. Accept header in HTTP), and SHOULD be used for selecting the RDFSyntax.

        The character set is assumed to be StandardCharsets.UTF_8 unless the protocol's equivalent of Content-Type specifies otherwise or the document declares its own charset (e.g. RDF/XML with a <?xml encoding="iso-8859-1"> header).

        The RDFParserBuilder.base(IRI) or RDFParserBuilder.base(String) MAY be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse(), otherwise the source IRI will be used as the base IRI.

        This method will override any source set with RDFParserBuilder.source(Path), RDFParserBuilder.source(InputStream) or RDFParserBuilder.source(String).

        Specified by:
        source in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        iri - An IRI to retrieve and parse
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified source.

      • source

        public RDFParserBuilder source(String iri)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Specify an absolute source IRI to retrieve and parse.

        The source set will not be read before the call to RDFParserBuilder.parse().

        If this builder does not support the given IRI (e.g. urn:uuid:ce667463-c5ab-4c23-9b64-701d055c4890), this method should succeed, while the RDFParserBuilder.parse() should throw an IOException.

        The RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax) or RDFParserBuilder.contentType(String) MAY be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse(), in which case that type MAY be used for content negotiation (e.g. Accept header in HTTP), and SHOULD be used for selecting the RDFSyntax.

        The character set is assumed to be StandardCharsets.UTF_8 unless the protocol's equivalent of Content-Type specifies otherwise or the document declares its own charset (e.g. RDF/XML with a <?xml encoding="iso-8859-1"> header).

        The RDFParserBuilder.base(IRI) or RDFParserBuilder.base(String) MAY be set before calling RDFParserBuilder.parse(), otherwise the source IRI will be used as the base IRI.

        This method will override any source set with RDFParserBuilder.source(Path), RDFParserBuilder.source(InputStream) or RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI).

        Specified by:
        source in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        iri - An IRI to retrieve and parse
        Returns:
        An RDFParserBuilder that will use the specified source.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the base is not a valid absolute IRI string

        Used by source(String) and base(String)

      • checkSource

        protected void checkSource()
                    throws IOException
        Check that one and only one source is present and valid.

        Used by parse().

        Subclasses might override this method, e.g. to support other source combinations, or to check if the sourceIri is resolvable.

        Throws:
        IOException - If a source file can't be read

      • checkBaseRequired

        protected void checkBaseRequired()
        Check if base is required.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if base is required, but not set.

      • resetSource

        protected void resetSource()
        Reset all source* fields to Optional.empty()

        Subclasses should override this and call super.resetSource() if they need to reset any additional source* fields.

      • parseSynchronusly

        protected abstract void parseSynchronusly()
                                   throws IOException,
                                          AbstractRDFParserBuilder.RDFParseException
        Parse sourceInputStream, sourceFile or sourceIri.

        One of the source fields MUST be present, as checked by checkSource().

        checkBaseRequired() is called to verify if getBase() is required.

        When this method is called, intoGraph MUST always be present, as that is where the parsed triples MUST be inserted into.

        Throws:
        IOException - If the source could not be read
        AbstractRDFParserBuilder.RDFParseException - If the source could not be parsed (e.g. a .ttl file was not valid Turtle)

      • prepareForParsing

        protected AbstractRDFParserBuilder prepareForParsing()
                                              throws IOException,
                                                     IllegalStateException
        Prepare a clone of this RDFParserBuilder which have been checked and completed.

        The returned clone will always have getIntoGraph() and getRdfTermFactory() present.

        If the getSourceFile() is present, but the getBase() is not present, the base will be set to the file:/// IRI for the Path's real path (e.g. resolving any symbolic links).

        Returns:
        A completed and checked clone of this RDFParserBuilder
        Throws:
        IOException - If the source was not accessible (e.g. a file was not found)
        IllegalStateException - If the parser was not in a compatible setting (e.g. contentType was an invalid string)

      • checkContentType

        protected void checkContentType()
                         throws IllegalStateException
        Subclasses can override this method to check compatibility with the contentType setting.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the getContentType() or getContentTypeSyntax() is not compatible or invalid

      • guessRDFSyntax

        protected static Optional<RDFSyntax> guessRDFSyntax(Path path)
        Guess RDFSyntax from a local file's extension.

        This method can be used by subclasses if getContentType() is not present and getSourceFile() is set.

        Parameters:
        path - Path which extension should be checked
        Returns:
        The RDFSyntax which has a matching RDFSyntax.fileExtension, otherwise Optional.empty().

      • createRDFTermFactory

        protected RDFTermFactory createRDFTermFactory()
        Create a new RDFTermFactory for a parse session.

        This is called by parse() to set rdfTermFactory(RDFTermFactory) if it is Optional.empty(), and therefore used also for creating a new Graph if getIntoGraph() is Optional.empty().

        As parsed blank nodes might be made with RDFTermFactory.createBlankNode(String), each call to this method should return a new RDFTermFactory instance.

        Returns:
        A new RDFTermFactory

      • parse

        public Future<Graph> parse()
                    throws IOException,
                           IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: RDFParserBuilder
        Parse the specified source.

        A source method (e.g. RDFParserBuilder.source(InputStream), RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI), RDFParserBuilder.source(Path), RDFParserBuilder.source(String) or an equivalent subclass method) MUST have been called before calling this method, otherwise an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

        It is undefined if this method is thread-safe, however the RDFParserBuilder may be reused (e.g. setting a different source) as soon as the Future has been returned from this method.

        The RDFParserBuilder SHOULD perform the parsing as an asynchronous operation, and return the Future as soon as preliminary checks (such as validity of the RDFParserBuilder.source(IRI) and RDFParserBuilder.contentType(RDFSyntax) settings) have finished. The future SHOULD not mark Future.isDone() before parsing is complete. A synchronous implementation MAY be blocking on the parse() call and return a Future that is already Future.isDone().

        If RDFParserBuilder.intoGraph(Graph) has been specified, this SHOULD be the same Graph instance returned from Future.get() once parsing has completed successfully.

        If an exception occurs during parsing, (e.g. IOException or ParseException), it should be indicated as the Throwable.getCause() in the ExecutionException thrown on Future.get().

        Specified by:
        parse in interface RDFParserBuilder
        Returns:
        A Future that will return the populated Graph when the parsing has finished.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurred while starting to read the source (e.g. file not found, unsupported IRI protocol). Note that IO errors during parsing would instead be the Throwable.getCause() of the ExecutionException thrown on Future.get().
        IllegalStateException - If the builder is in an invalid state, e.g. a source has not been set.
